newsitem.title: CHAD: Chad reopens university closed after protests.
newsitem.headline: Chad reopens university closed after protests.

text.p: Authorities in Chad have reopened N'Djamena university, closed last week after two days of protests over grant arrears in which Education Minister Nagoum Yamassoum was held hostage for four hours.
Yamassoum issued a statement on Wednesday inviting students to return to classes.
Students demanding payment of four months' grant arrears attacked the university offices and gendarmes had to intervene to rescue the minister and other officials.

Eight student union leaders remain in detention but other students detained after the protests have been released. The closure meant end-of-year examinations scheduled for September 2 could not be held.
